item.name: User Slot Position For a Cycle

response.name: User Slot Position For a Cycle

request.description:
### Overview.

Duration can be one of month/months/week/weeks.  
If the cycle the slot belongs to has a monthly frequency, then the durations should be in `week|weeks`, i.e.

``` json
{
 "duration": "4 weeks"
 }

 ```

if the cycle frequency is monthly, then the duration should be in `month|months` i.e.

``` json
{
 "duration": "4 months"
 }

 ```

> NOTE: Ensure the duration of slot freeze is not greater than duration of the cycle, i.e. a cycle with duration of 6 months, would not allow a slot freeze with duration of 7 months.

item.name: Notifications

response.name: User notifications

item.description:
All notifications have the same structure  
\- id  
\- created_at  
\- updated_at  
\- message  
\- title  
\- meta  
\- section

The only thing that differs is the content of meta, meta will always be an object but can have different.

Meta contains ids that can be used to take actions, they are specific to different sections

section: group_invitation (when a group invite is sent to you)  
meta: { group_id, invite_id }

section: join_group (when a user accepts invite to join a group)  
meta: { group_id, new_user_id }

section: join_cycle (when a new user joins your group)  
meta: { user_id, cycle_id }

section: slot_switch_request  
meta: { swap_id, from_user_id, from_slot_id }

section: slot_switch_decision  
meta: { swap_id, to_user_id, to_slot_id }
The `/me` endpoints let you manage information about the authenticated user.
